
### exec*  {.smaller}


* exec* --- <em>replace</em> current program with new program 

   * * --- multiple variants
   * same pid, new process image

* <code>int execv(const char *path, const char **argv)</code> 

   * path: new program to run
   * argv: array of arguments, termianted by null pointer

* also other variants that take argv in different form and/or environment variables* 

   * []{.my-small} *environment variables = list of key-value pairs



### execv example  {.smaller}


<pre><code>  ...
  child_pid = fork();
  if (child_pid == 0) {
    /* child process */
    char *args\[] = <span data-fragment-index="2" class="fragment custom myem-only">{"ls", "-l", NULL}</span>;
    execv(<span data-fragment-index="3" class="fragment custom myem-only">"/bin/ls"</span>, <span data-fragment-index="2" class="fragment custom myem-only">args</span>);
    /* execv doesn't return when it works.
       So, if we got here, it failed. */
    perror("execv");
    exit(1);
  } else if (child_pid &gt; 0) {
    /* parent process */
    ...
  }
</code></pre>
